intro: Pimpinella saxifraga f. subrotunda, commonly known as the broadleaf cow-wheat, is a flowering plant characterized by its distinctive, kidney-shaped leaves. It belongs to the family Apiaceae, which includes many aromatic herbs and vegetables. The plant typically grows in calcareous soils and is often found in rocky or gravelly habitats. Its small, yellowish-white flowers are clustered in umbels, a common feature among members of the Apiaceae family. This subspecies is notable for its unique leaf morphology and its role in supporting local pollinator populations.
